titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Allan Dwan papers, 1905-1981
titlestmt.author: Processed by Rochelle Kaylor

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid was encoded by Mary Ann Meyer in April 2007 and revised by D.C. Thompson in October 2007

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Collection contains photographs, manuscripts, video cassettes, correspondence, contracts, and other materials of film director Allan Dwan.

bioghist.head: Biography of Allan Dwan
bioghist.p: Allan Dwan was a film director. He was born in Toronto, Canada on April 3, 1885. He graduated from the University of Notre Dame with a degree in electrical engineering. Allan worked for Essanay as a scenario editor, later moving to the American Film Company. He married Betty Marie Shelton and had no children. He directed more than 400 films from 1909 until his death. His pictures included "Hold Back the Night", "Restless Breed", and "Rivers Edge." Allan Dwan died of heart failure on December 21, 1981 at the age of 96.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains, photographs, manuscripts written by and about Allan Dwan, government documents, awards, gifts, video cassettes, correspondence, film agreements, purchases, artifacts and certificates.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Allan Dwan at the date of processing.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The collection was listed by Rochelle Kaylor in April 2007.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Item Description, Box Number, Folder Number, Collection Name, Collection Number, American Heritage Center, University of Wyoming.

scopecontent.p: This material has been archivally housed but has not been organized.
